trans-unit.source: Specifies a series of conversion methods that are useful when interoperating with the Win32 printing API.
This class cannot be inherited.
Typically, this class is not called directly.
For more information on printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
Converts a double-precision floating-point number from one <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref> type to another <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref> type.
The following table shows the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit> values.

|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |`Display`|The default unit (0.01 in.).| |`ThousandthsOfAnInch`|One-thousandth of an inch (0.001 in.).| |`HundredthsOfAMillimeter`|One-hundredth of a millimeter (0.01 mm).| |`TenthsOfAMillimeter`|One-tenth of a millimeter (0.1 mm).|
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> being converted.
The unit to convert from.
The unit to convert to.
A double-precision floating-point number that represents the converted <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref>.
Converts a <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> from one <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref> type to another <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref> type.

The <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> being converted.
The unit to convert from.
The unit to convert to.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that represents the converted <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref>.

Converts a 32-bit signed integer from one <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref> type to another <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref> type.

The unit to convert to.
A 32-bit signed integer that represents the converted <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterUnit"></xref>.
